metadata.feature_description: View and manage activity stream specific to groups

steps.action: Navigate to Groups page from main navigation
steps.expected: Groups page loads showing available groups
steps.actual: Groups page loaded successfully showing 'Wiki Test Group' with 1 member

steps.action: Click on Wiki Test Group to view its activity stream
steps.expected: Group activity page opens with Activity tab selected
steps.actual: Group activity page opened with group header, Activity tab selected, and activity stream displayed showing group-specific posts

steps.expected: Activity posts specific to this group are visible
steps.actual: Group-specific posts visible including 'Test post to Wiki Test Group activity stream' and wiki article entries. Group Owner and Administrators sections displayed on sidebar.

steps.action: Click on 'Tell the world something...' input area
steps.actual: Post editor activated with Share button appearing

steps.action: Enter test message: 'Automated test post for Group Activity Stream testing - verifying post creation in group context'
steps.actual: Text successfully entered in the contenteditable area with Share button visible

steps.action: Click Share button to post the message
steps.expected: Post is created and appears in the activity stream
steps.actual: Post created successfully showing 'moments ago' timestamp with Like, Comment, Unsubscribe, Remove, Pin options
Dropdown opened showing multiple filter options: Posts, Links, Photos, Files, Forum Topics, Forum Replies, Blogs, Friends, Group Created, Group Joined, Added to Wiki, Updated Wiki, and many more

steps.expected: Activity stream filters to show only posts
steps.actual: Activity stream filtered to show only post entries - 3 posts displayed

steps.expected: Activity stream filters to show only wiki-related activities
steps.actual: Activity stream filtered to show only wiki article entry - 'authored wiki article Group Integration Test Article'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Moderate group posts as group admin (Pin/Unpin)

steps.action: Click 'Pin' link on the automated test post
steps.expected: Post is pinned and moves to top of feed
steps.actual: Post was pinned successfully - link changed to 'Unpin' and post moved to top of activity stream with pin icon visible

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Moderate group posts as group admin (Remove)

steps.action: Click 'Remove' link on the automated test post
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared with message 'Are you sure you want to delete this item?' and Yes/No buttons

steps.expected: Post is removed from the activity stream
steps.actual: Post was successfully deleted and no longer appears in the activity stream

steps.action: Verify current user is group member and can see all posts
steps.expected: Group member can view all activity posts including member-only posts
steps.actual: As Group Owner (shown as 'You' in sidebar), all posts are visible including one labeled 'Testing Group Members privacy option - this post should only be visible to group members'. Post editor is available indicating member privileges.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test group activity with different group types

steps.action: Verify group configuration and activity stream behavior
steps.expected: Group activity stream functions based on group type settings
steps.actual: Wiki Test Group is accessible with full Activity tab showing group-specific content. Group header displays group info (1 MEMBERS, established date). Code review confirms different behavior for public vs private groups - private groups restrict access for non-members while public groups allow viewing but not posting for non-members.

observations: The group activity stream correctly isolates activities to the specific group context (URL contains groupid/10)
Code review shows group access is controlled via RoleController - checking if user IsInRole for the group's role
For private groups (IsPublic=false), non-members cannot view the activity stream (ctlJournalList.Enabled=false)
For public groups, non-members can view but ShowEditor=false prevents posting
Post privacy option 'Group Members' visible in existing posts indicates per-post visibility controls
Only one group (Wiki Test Group) exists in the system for testing; creating additional groups to test different types would require Group Management module
